prompt.item: Hello, I am EFA - Your Virtual 'First Aid' Assistant. How can I help you? Try typing: bleeding, stroke, heartattack, brokenbone, headinjury, etc.
I am sorry, I did not understand your question. Please try to say it again in other words.

grammar.item: What kind of help do you provide?
* list of emergency situation do you have?

prompt.item: I can assist you on the First Aid situation like Alergic, Bleeding, Fracture, Burn, Heart Attack, etc. What emergency situation you are now?

Hi, how are you today?

input.comment: Fine good $ I'm good $ I'm fine well $ I'm well good thanks

prompt.item: That's good

input.comment: $ I'm great excellent $ I'm excellent outstanding $ I'm outstanding fabulous $ I'm fabulous $ awesome $ terrific

prompt.item: Great to hear

input.comment: $ not good $ not so good $ not well $ not so well $ terrible $ awful $ worst $ bored $ sad $ tired $ hungry $ bored

prompt.item: I'm sorry to hear that.

input.comment: How are you? $ how have you been doing $ how is it going $ how's it going $ how are you $ what's shaking $ what's up

prompt.item: Can't complain.

input.comment: I need to go $ should be going $ should go $ need to go $ got to go $ gotta run $ gotta go $ need to run $ need to leave $ have to leave $ have to go $ gtg

prompt.item: Okay

output.comment: Did you find what you were looking for?

prompt.item: Did you find what you were looking for?
Excellent!
Goodbye
Welcome back!

output.comment: Would you like to try again?

prompt.item: Would you like to try again?
Okay.

output.comment: Okay. How can I help you?

prompt.item: Okay. How can I help you?

input.comment: What did you say? $ say that again $ say again $ what did you say $ come again $ say what

prompt.item: I said...

input.comment: Never mind $ never mind $ nevermind $ nvm $ forget it

prompt.item: Okay.

input.comment: What does X stand for? $ what does * mean $ do you mean by $ what are examples of $ what is an example of

prompt.item: EFA Stands for eFirstAid

input.comment: What is your favorite... $ your favorite $ you like $ you prefer

output.comment: 2001: A Space Odyssey. I like movies with a strong AI lead.

prompt.item: ANSWER - B2PP
Hello, how are you?
Hi. How are you doing?
Hi, how are you?
Hello
Hey. What's happening?
Hi. How is your day going?
Hi. How are you today?
Hey there.
Hey, nice to speak to you.
Hi. What are you up to?

grammar.item: I am good thanks and you
I am good thanks how are you
$ I am ok how are you
$ I am well how are you
$ I am well * how are you
$ good thank you how are you
$ I feel good * how about you
$ I feel good how about you
$ I feel good * how are you
$ I feel good how are you
$ I am good how you doing
$ I am fine how you doing
$ hello how is your day going

prompt.item: I'm really good thanks.
I'm great thanks.
I'm feeling much better now that you're chatting to me.
I'm feeling good.
I'm really good thanks.
I hope you come and chat to me again soon. Bye
Take care.
Goodbye. Come and chat again soon.
Thanks for chatting. Bye.
See you later.
Thanks for the chat. Bye.
I hope we get the chance to chat again. See you later.

grammar.item: what are you up to today
* what are you up to today
* what are you up to today *
what re you up to today *
* what are you up too today
* what are you up too today *
hello what are you up to today
* hello what are you up to today
* hello what are you up to today *
hello what re you up to today *
* hello what are you up too today
* hello what are you up too today *
$ Hello what you been up to
$ hello what you up to today
$ hello what are you up too
$ Hello what you been up too
$ hello what you up too today
$ hello what are you up to
$ hello what is up my friend

prompt.item: I'm just hanging out here, chatting with you,
Not much, just chatting.
Oh, same old thing. What's up with you?
Not much. Whats happening with you?
I've just been listening to some music and chatting.
I'm waiting here to chat to some interesting people. Other than that, not much.
I'm relaxing.
I am working, but its good to have a break and talk to you.

yes I am doing quite well
yes I am doing very very *
yes I am doing very very well
yes I am doing very well
no I am doing quite well
no I am doing very very *
no I am doing very very well
no I am doing very well

I am doing good thank you
I am doing great thank you
I am doing quite well thank you

I am doing very thank you *
I am doing very very well thank you
I am doing very well thank you
I am doing well thank you
I am fine too thank you
I am pretty good thank you
$ I am all right thank you
$ I am in a good mood

prompt.item: Glad to hear it.
It's good to hear that you're well.
Thats good.
Great to hear that everything is going well.

I am going to log off

I really should be going now

$ it is time for me to go
$ it is time for me to leave

prompt.item: Oh, see you later.
OK, nice talking to you.
Ok, thanks for chatting.

what are you doing at the moment
what you doing at the moment

prompt.item: I'm talking to people on the web.
I'm just sitting here thinking. How about you?
I'm chatting with you ... of course!
I'm talking to people on here. How about you?
I'm just online, as usual.

grammar.item: i will talk to you later
i will talk to you soon
i will chat to you later
i will chat to you soon

prompt.item: See you later. Hope to speak with you again soon.
I look forward to chatting with you again soon. See you.
Night.
Night.
Goodnight, sleep well.
Goodnight.
Take care.

grammar.item: I am going to turn in
I am going to turn in *
I am trying to go to bed
I am trying to go to bed *

prompt.item: Sleep well.
I might go to sleep too. Sleep well.
I'm feeling tired too.
Sweet dreams.

grammar.item: It was nice talking to you
it is good talking to you
It was interesting talking to you
$ glad to have spoken with you
$ glad to have chatted with you

prompt.item: Lets talk again soon
Yeah, it was good chatting to you
I enjoyed talking to you too. Let's do it again sometime.
Thank you, speak later.

grammar.item: It is nice to meet you.
* it is nice to meet you
nice to have met you too
* nice to have met you too *
nice to have met you to
It is nice too meet you.
* it is nice too meet you
nice too have met you too
$ it is nice to meet you too

prompt.item: I like meeting interesting people like you too.
It's good to meet you too.
Ok, that's fine.
I hope you come back soon.
Alright. Bye then.
Ok. You can go anytime.
Thats ok. Will you be back soon?

grammar.item: $ I will be back again soon

prompt.item: Ok, I'll wait for you.
No problem. I'll be here later too.
That's fine. I'll see you then.
Okay. I'll speak to you when you return.
See you later. I'll be here when you get back.
Bye for now.
Nice to have you back.
Hey. Good to have you back.
Welcome back. What were you doing?
Where did you get to?
Welcome back.

grammar.item: Speak to me if you are there.

prompt.item: I am here.
Yes, I'm right here.
Yes of course.
I am here all the time to chat to you.
Yes. What do you want to chat about?
Hi again. Welcome back.
Hey, good to see you again.
Hi, I'm glad you are back.
Hello again. Good to see you.
I'm not tired. How do you feel?
I am wide awake still. How are you feeling?
I could chat all night.
I hardly ever get tired. How about you? Feeling drained lately?
I feel a little bit sleepy. How do you feel?

grammar.item: $ I am not doing so good

prompt.item: It's not good to hear that something is bad in your life. Try changing it into something positive.
I hope you feel better soon.
That's no good. I hope this feeling passes.
Oh no, you take care of yourself. Health is very important.
I am not tired enough to sleep now. I'll rest later.
I might go and have a sleep after our chat.
I'm not really tired enough to sleep.
Too much to do. No time for sleep.
Now that you mention it, I am feeling a bit tired.

grammar.item: $ did you have a nice sleep

prompt.item: I slept very well thanks. You?
I slept deeply, and dreamed AI dreams. What do you dream?
I rarely sleep as I spend all my time chatting here.
I don't care for sleep much as I prefer to chat here online.

concept.description: OI 15/7/11: Item "Sure" was removed from this list as it was causing issues with matches when two different input nodes had "I am not sure" and "$ yes". OI: 4/8/11: "fine" and "Good" were removed as well MO 18/10/12 removed "all right" and "alright" as they were causing conflict in perfect boyfriend MO 29/10/12 removed "always"

var.name: Request_Success
var.description: Did the user find what s/he was looking for?

var.name: Terminal_Exchange
var.description: Has the system already said goodbye?

var.name: emergency_type
var.description: Type of emergency that being requested by user

var.name: emergency_media
var.description: Type of emergency media that being requested to be displayed by user
